Field Label: Below are a few questions about getting tested for HIV. Remember, an HIV test checks whether someone has the virus that causes AIDS.
1. Have you ever been tested for HIV?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 0, No | 1, Yes | 7, Refused to answer | 9, Don't know

Field Label:
If the answer to Q1 is NO = skip to Q4
If the answer to Q1 is Refused or Don't know, end the protocol
If the answer to Q1 is YES = go to Q2 and continue
2. What month (1-12) did you have your most recent HIV test?
2a. What year did you have your most recent HIV test?
3. What was the result of your most recent HIV test?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, Negative | 2, Positive | 3, Never obtained results | 4, Indeterminate | 7, Refused to answer | 9, Don't know

Field Label:
INTERVIEWER INSTRUCTIONS: Refer to Q2. LAST HIV TEST WAS DONE (Check one):

? 12 months ago. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .[ ] End protocol

> 12 months ago. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .[ ] Go to Q4

Date of last test Don't know/Refused. . . .[ ] End protocol
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels:
1, ? 12 months ago.
2, > 12 months ago
3, Don't know/Refused

Field Label: 4. I'm going to read you a list of reasons why some people have not been tested for HIV. Which of these best describes the most important reason you have not been tested for HIV in the past 12 months?
Choices, Calculations, OR Slider Labels: 1, You think you are at low risk for HIV infection? | 2, You were afraid of finding out that you had HIV? | 3, You didn't have time? | 4, Some other reason? | 5, No particular reason | 7, Refused to answer | 9, Don't know
